isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - CATERPILLAR - 1992 - 1993 - COMPONENT LOCATIONS - CAT 3176 ENGINE WIRING

svcproc.title: CAT 3176 ENGINE WIRING
svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 51, Figure 52, Figure 53, Figure 54, Figure 55, and Figure 56.

figure.caption: Figure 51 - 3176 Engine Wiring At Dash Panel

calloutgroup.callout1: NOTE: CONNECTOR NUMBERS SHOWN IN PARENTHESES
1. ENGINE HARNESS
2. REF: PART OF STOP, TAIL & TURN WIRING
3. CIRCUIT 14A (PART OF MAIN CAB WIRING)
4. START MAGNETIC SWITCH (SEE FIGURE 55 FOR CONNECTIONS)
5. LOW COOLANT SENSOR SEE FIGURE 55
6. CIRCUIT 11-GA (STARTER GRD) CONNECTS TO J7 CAB GROUND
7. REF: PART OF FRONT END WIRING
8. CIRCUIT 11-GA (SEE FIGURE 55)
9. SEE FIGURE 52 AND FIGURE 53
NOTE: CONNECTOR NUMBERS SHOWN IN PARENTHESES
1. INTERNATIONAL 40-WAY CONNECTOR (191) CONNECTS TO J7 CAT HARNESS CONNECTOR (J7 IS THE CATERPILLAR CONNECTOR NUMBER)
2. REF: ENGINE FAN SOLENOID CIRCUITS 23D & 23-GB
3. REF: A/C PRESSURE SWITCH CIRCUITS 23C & 23D
4. REF: A/C PRESSURE SWITCH (SEE FIGURE 55)
5. CIRCUIT 24D TO FRONT ENGINE BRAKE SOLENOID
6. CIRCUIT 24F TO CENTER ENGINE BRAKE SOLENOID
7. CIRCUIT 24H TO REAR ENGINE BRAKE SOLENOID
8. SEE FIGURE 51
9. CYLINDER HEAD GROUND CIRCUITS 11-GB, 11-GC, 11-GD, 11-DF, 11-GL & 24-G
10. REF: ETHER START THERMOSTAT & CIRCUIT 21A
11. REF: TACHOMETER SENSOR
12. REF: TRANSMISSION OIL TEMPERATURE GAUGE CONNECTOR (235)
13. SEE FIGURE 54 AND FIGURE 55
14. REF: TACHOMETER CONNECTOR (111)
15. REF: CIRCUIT 11-GA TO CAB GROUND (SEE FIGURE 50 AND FIGURE 55)
16. REF: ENGINE OIL TEMPERATURE GAUGE CONNECTOR (229), CIRCUITS 30A & 30-GA
17. SEE FIGURE 55 FOR STARTER END VIEW
18. THERMAL OVERCRANK PROTECTION CONNECTOR (293)
NOTE: CONNECTOR NUMBERS SHOWN IN PARENTHESES
1. REF: FAN CLUTCH SWITCH (237) - SEE FIGURE 55
2. REF: ENGINE WATER TEMP SENDER (231)
3. SEE FIGURE 51
4. INTERNATIONAL ENGINE HARNESS
5. REF: WITH A/C, JUMPER DIODE HARNESS CONNECTS TO CIRCUIT 77C OF ENGINE HARNESS AND TO A/C COMPRESSOR CLUTCH CIRCUIT. DIODE EYELET TERMINAL GROUNDS AT A/C COMPRESSOR.
6. JUMPER DIODE HARNESS
7. REF: CATERPILLAR SPEED/TIMING SENSOR
8. SEE FIGURE 56 FOR ALTERNATOR CONNECTIONS

figure.caption: Figure 54 - CAT 3176 Engine Wiring at Transmission (Spicer Shown, Wiring is Typical)

calloutgroup.callout1: NOTE: CONNECTOR NUMBERS SHOWN IN PARENTHESES
1. SEE FIGURE 52
2. VEHICLE SPEEDOMETER CONNECTOR (258), CIRCUITS 47J & 47K
3. REF: BACKUP LIGHT SWITCH
4. SPEEDOMETER SENSOR CABLE CONNECTOR (197) TO SPEED BUFFER CABLE.
5. CATERPILLAR SPEED BUFFER
6. SPEED BUFFER 5-WAY CONNECTION (193) TO ENGINE HARNESS
7. ENGINE HARNESS
NOTE: CONNECTOR NUMBERS SHOWN IN PARENTHESES

VIEW IN DIRECTION OF ARROW A A. MAGNETIC START SWITCH B. TORQUE 48-72 IN LBS (5-8 N·m) C. APPLY GRAPHO GREASE WHEN CONNECTIONS ARE COMPLETE D. CIRCUITS 2, 14, 14A, 14K, ATTACHED TO ONE 5/16 STUD E. CIRCUIT 17C ATTACHED TO OPPOSITE 5/16 STUD F. CIRCUIT 17B ATTACHED TO #10 STUD
VIEW M WITH VISCOUS FAN (NOT WITH AUTOMATIC FAN) SEALING PLUG (B) INSERTED INTO (A) WHICH IS THE ENGINE HARNESS FAN TEMP SWITCH CONNECTOR
VIEW IN DIRECTION OF ARROW F A. CAUTION LABEL B. SURGE TANK C. ENGINE HARNESS CONNECTOR (249) AT LOW COOLANT LEVEL SWITCH
VIEW N WITHOUT AIR CONDITIONING (A/C) JUMPER CONNECTOR (B) INSERTED INTO (A) WHICH IS THE ENGINE HARNESS A/C PRESSURE SWITCH CONNECTOR (228)

VIEW IN DIRECTION OF ARROW E OF STARTER MOTOR A. CIRCUIT 11-GB (STARTER TO CYL HEAD GRD) B. CIRCUIT 11-GL (ALTERNATOR GRD) C. TORQUE 20-25 FT-LBS (27-34 N·m) D. CIRCUIT 14 (BATTERY FEED TO START MAG SW) E. APPLY GRAPHO GREASE WHEN ASSY IS COMPLETE F. TORQUE 16-30 IN-LBS (1.8-3.4 N·m) G. CIRCUIT 17C (FROM START MAG SW) H. CIRCUIT 11-GA (CAB GROUND) - SEE FIGURE 51 I. TORQUE 105 FT-LBS (140 N·m) 3-PLACES
VIEW J DELCO GENERATOR A. CIRCUIT 11-GL B. MAIN ENGINE HARNESS C. CIRCUIT 2 D. TORQUE 55-70 IN LBS (6.2-8.0 N·m) APPLY GRAPHO GREASE WHEN ASSEMBLY IS COMPLETE
VIEW J WITH LEECE-NEVILLE GENERATOR A. CIRCUIT 11-GL B. MAIN ENGINE HARNESS C. CIRCUIT 2 D. TORQUE 50-60 IN LBS (5.6-6.8 N·m) APPLY GRAPHO GREASE WHEN ASSEMBLY IS COMPLETE
